subject: Communication
title: Confirmation Bias: The Filter You Don't See
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Confirmation Bias: The Filter You Don't See.

hook.text: You Google a question and click the first result that agrees with you. The other nine? Invisible.

buildup.text: Confirmation bias is the tendency to seek, favor, and remember information that confirms your existing beliefs.

discovery.text: It's not just what you seek. It's what you notice: your brain literally filters out information that contradicts your.

twist.text: The smarter you are, the better you are at rationalizing your biases.

climax.text: The antidote: actively seek opposing viewpoints. Read the source you disagree with most.

punchline.text: You're not objective. Nobody is. Knowing that is the first step.

quiz.question: How does intelligence affect confirmation bias?
options: Intelligence can amplify it through better rationalization
